content:
add your account a second time as IMAP. (I am assuming it is POP now) Do not remove of delete anything.

Allow the server messages to synchronize to Thunderbird. Then drag your selected messages from the IMAP folder to the appropriate location in Thunderbird. That will "move" them as in delete them from the server. You can also right click messages and select copy or move to achieve the same thing or just copy.

Once you have done that you can remove the IMAP mail account from Thunderbird.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
There is a donate tab, which you should not see once when the application updates. You close the tab and it should stay gone. There is also a standard Thunderbird page that loads when the application starts. It to contains a reference to donation, but also contains information about Thunderbird and support.

Get messages should automatically initiate when Thunderbird starts. Then there is a cloud icon in the top of the folder pane that gets all messages for all accounts. Then there is a get messages icon in the toolbar which only gets messages for the currently selected account. It only ever did, but few people appear to have been aware of that. Generally assuming it got everything and complaining it was broken when it did not.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: It may help to know how you copied thunderbird data to external drive, and it also may help to know if old computer is still available. Generally, if you copied the profile, the accounts will be there for you, but you mentioned the accounts themselves are missing. My hope is the old computer is still available. Please tell me more.
creator: davidsk

content:
I would suggest you look at the frequency of connections.

Historically Thunderbird approaches connecting to get mail as a sequential thing, so five accounts would be connected one after the other. Now it is a multi threaded thing where all five may attempt to connect at once.

I have no idea if this will help, but it might.

Stretch out the frequency of connection as far as you feel you can. Stagger the frequency 15 minutes for one account 17 for another so they all do not click over at the same time. Keep in mind that hotmail used to refuse connections that arrived at less than 15 minute frequency. so do not set account to a lesser time.

If you are using IMAP accounts try changing the connections in server settings > advance to 1 or 2. It will slow the download, but it might reduce the errors as well.

If you are not using oauth authentication, consider using it. Microsoft are in the process of enforcing it, (slowly), and if they have not got to you yet, you will only be ahead of the game.

Consider dropping email scanning if your antivirus product offers it. Some A/V product struggle to multitask on multiple mail connections at the same time. I think anyway. I know I do not have the issue and use Microsoft Defender which has no mail scanner.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Ohh, and you go to account settings on the menu to change account settings. You do not try and add the account again. It is a popular method of really making a mess that I do not understand, but must accept is occurring and warn against it.

If you access your hotmail account on this link https://outlook.live.com/mail/0/options/mail/accounts ytou will see a link at the bottom of the settings for POP etc to the page I link to below. I think it is a generic page these days, but it might be better to access it that way, just in case it is not generic.

Microsoft publish the following setting that you should use. https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/pop-imap-and-smtp-settings-for-outlook-com-d088b986-291d-42b8-9564-9c414e2aa040

I still have a venerable hotmail account, but using the outlook.office365.com for incoming and smtp-mail.outlook.com for outgoing server names. I think I updated them when I changed the authentication method to oauth as that is only avaiable with certain server names.

If oauth is not available. change the server name, close the account settings and open them again and retry. The authentication method list only refreshes when the panel opens. Not when the server name changes.

content:
This is de jure in Google and Hotmail as those providers add the outgoing message to the sent folder as it passes through their server. As they do not offer an opt-out option for their bit of helpfulness and as Thunderbird defaults to making a copy, just about everyone gets two copies in the send folder.

It is a simple thing to turn of the making of sent mail copies in the copies and folders part of account settings by deselecting the place a copy in check mark.

What actually surprises me is how few people ask this question. There are other settings that get more questions asked that I see as easier to find. So I am left wondering of a significant percentage of folk are just putting up with two copies of everything.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
OK, I've found the answer myself through experimentation. One webpage I found said "Right click on the account name and click on 'Settings'. An additional tab entitled 'Account Settings' will appear, select the 'Outgoing Server (SMTP)' left-hand menu option." This is what I call a "lie". What actually happens is that a new tab opens on the RHS and if you scroll down RIGHT TO THE BOTTOM you will find the SMTP details hidden away where nobody would look for them.

Frankly, I think the idea of a default SMTP server is ridiculous, since the security settings for the incoming servers might all be different, but what do I know?

Matthew Fisher

content:
Je pravdepodobné, že máte narušený profil Thunderbirdu. Vytvorte si NOVÝ PROFIL. Na vytvorenie nového profilu môžete použiť príkazy v ponuke Štart (WIN+R) a tu vypíšte: "thunderbird -p" - bez úvodzoviek a preverte, či problém pretrváva. Ak problém nepominie, tak sa môžete vrátiť k pôvodnému profilu tiež príkazom "thunderbird -p" http://imgbank.cz/images/2015/08/20/Thunderbird_novy_profil.jpg

Do NOVÉHO PROFILU si potom cez "Nástroje“ - „Importovať" - „Importovať z inej inštalácie Thunderbirdu“ importujte všetky účty a nastavenia, adresáre, e-mailové správy a kalendár ... zo STARÉHO profilu Thunderbirdu - zvolte si iba to čo potrebujete. https://imgbank.cz/images/2023/10/25/Thunderbird_import.jpg

Ak je problém odstránený, potom pokračujte v tvorbe (budovaní) NOVÉHO PROFILU Thunderbirdu. Nakoniec môžete ten STARÝ profil odstrániť.

content:
HI, it takes a long time to sync when you are uploading to Gmail because Internet connections usually have a much lower upload speed than download speed. As well, the Google server will control your upload rate to fairly share bandwidth among users.

When you are running Thunderbird, watch the status bar at the bottom of the window to see if the progress bar for syncing shows. If not, try clicking the Send/Receive button.

content:
Olá Maison Sakamoto,

Parece que você está enfrentando dificuldades com a autenticação de duas contas do Gmail no Thunderbird. Aqui estão algumas sugestões que podem ajudá-lo a resolver esse problema:

Verifique suas credenciais: Certifique-se de estar inserindo o endereço de e-mail e senha corretos para a conta do Gmail. Às vezes, erros de digitação podem causar problemas de autenticação.

Habilite a autenticação de dois fatores: Se você ativou a autenticação de dois fatores para sua conta do Gmail, pode ser necessário criar uma senha de aplicativo específica para o Thunderbird. Isso garante que o Thunderbird possa acessar sua conta com segurança. Você pode gerar uma senha de aplicativo nas configurações de segurança da sua conta do Google.

Verifique as configurações de segurança da conta: Certifique-se de que sua conta do Gmail não está bloqueada devido a atividades suspeitas ou tentativas de acesso não autorizadas. Verifique as configurações de segurança da sua conta para ver se há algum aviso ou bloqueio.

Atualize o Thunderbird: Certifique-se de estar usando a versão mais recente do Thunderbird. Às vezes, problemas de autenticação podem ser corrigidos com atualizações de software.

Verifique as configurações de segurança do Google: Verifique se você concedeu todas as permissões necessárias ao Thunderbird para acessar sua conta do Gmail. Isso pode ser feito nas configurações de segurança da sua conta do Google.

Se nenhuma dessas soluções resolver o problema, pode ser útil entrar em contato com o suporte técnico do Thunderbird ou do Google para obter assistência adicional.

Espero que isso ajude a resolver o problema! Se precisar de mais alguma coisa, estou à disposição para ajudar.

Atenciosamente, ROCKET-NET-PRÓ
creator: ROCKETNET

content: That is a difficult issue to do, as I see many attempts and no one has had good success that I have seen. This is not a Thunderbird issue, but an IMAP structure issue. Copying a small number of messages at a time usually works, and one approach that had good success was to create a filter to do the move, as that slows the process a bit. I suggest reviewing a sample of messages after the transfer to verify completeness.

content: Thanks for these links. This worked for me. I ran up a spare VM and installed a old version of Thunderbird (v78) which would allow me to install the add-on for moving folders between local folders and the IMAP account. The next part was optional but useful, I made a copy of the profile so that the user could continue to use their emails on the original profile. I then went into the copy profile on Thunderbird 78 and copied all the folders onto the IMAP account. Once done I asked the user to confirm that all the folders they needed were present on the IMAP email account and once confirmed deleted the copy of the profile. All that was left was for the user to delete the original folders from their 'local folders'. Thanks again for the help on this.

content: This is because the dashes are a universal signal to recipient's email client that responses should remove the sig as clutter. If there are dashes in sig when placed before the quote, that signals to strip everything on a reply.

content:
andrea.ballarati said
Ok, capirei se fosse così per tutte le installazioni Thunderbird, ma perché sul laptop mi funziona e sul desktop no?

Come è spiegato nella discussione che ti indicato (sono 11 pagine!), Google può far scattare una serie di blocchi basati su IP, tipo di applicazione, metodo di autenticazione, cookie, token e probabilmente anche altro. In questi casi o provi i vari metodi descritti in quella discussione sperando che servano a sbloccare l'accesso o contatti Google e speri che lo sblocco lo facciano manualmente.

Se ti stai chiedendo quale sia il senso, la risposta è semplice: Google vive di pubblicità e se tu accedi a Gmail tramite client di pubblicità non ne vedi.

E se ti sembra strano che Google penalizzi un client terzo rispetto ai propri prodotti, beh è già successo -> https://www.dday.it/redazione/27445/mozilla-accusa-google-youtube-e-stato-rallentato-di-proposito-su-firefox-e-microsoft-edge -> https://www.zdnet.com/article/youtube-is-slowing-video-loads-on-firefox-heres-how-to-fix-that/

Dopodiché se vuoi continuare a pensare che il problema sia Thunderbird, fa pure.

content: Ok, what may have happened was a Thunderbird update that may have been interrupted by an anti-virus program. If you do run an antivirus (other than the free Windows Defender), it may help for the future to see if it has settings to bypass email. BUT, to focus on your issue: - when you see the pane to create an email account, that is an indication that the profile has problems and Thunderbird set up a new profile. - if menu bar isn't visible, click the alt key to see it. then, click help>troubleshooting information, scroll down left side to 'profile folder' and click 'open profile' - exit thunderbird - note the name of folder, as that is the current thunderbird profile - back up one folder in File Explorer. That should place you at the ...thunderbird/profiles folder. - look in the folder to see if there are other profiles. If so, click inside to see if your account is there. It will be in the Mail folder of POP or the Imapmail folder for IMAP. Any local folders would be in the Mail\Local Folders folder. - post screenshots if you find your accounts and we can go from there.
creator: davidsk

content: Is the old PC still available? If so, do this - on old PC, with Thunderbird not running, copy c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming\thunderbird to external drive - on new PC, with thunderbird installed but not running - copy the exported Thunderbird folder to c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming to overwrite the existing thunderbird folder - restart thunderbird on new PC

content: Okay, I am assuming these are Windows PCs and that Thunderbird works properly on old PC. If you view the profiles.ini file in the thunderbird folder on the external drive you copied to, it will show the name of the active profile folder, the name of which usually ends in default or default-release . That is the profile that was copied to new PC and you should see it intact on the new PC in the ...appdata\roaming\thunderbird\profiles folder. if you view the profiles.ini on the new PC, it should look exactly like what was on old PC, since you copied it directly. Please review and let me know what you find. Thanks.

content: Thunderbird doesn't require a reboot when being uninstalled, so my guess is that you have a connection with Acrobat, since you mentioned settings there. You can force Thunderbird off your PC by removing it manually. The program is usually at c:\program files\thunderbird or c:\program files (x86)\thunderbird, and associated files for accounts and email messages at c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming\thunderbird. Removing those folders from within Windows File Explorer removes Thunderbird. But, if Acrobat has links to it, you may still see messages.
creator: davidsk

content:
A beállításoknál az elrendezés, függőleges nézet esetében sok olyan levél van, ami széles egyszerű text formátumú, azaz nem oszlopba formázott, és a keskeny nézetben a hosszú széles sorok nem jól adják ki magukat az olvashatóság terén, ezért választottam a széles nézetet amire megoldást keresek.

A miheztartás végett, a laptop képernyőjén 6 pixel = 1mm azaz 12 pixel magas betűk csak 2mm kicsik a tetejétől a talpáig így a betű törzse olykor csak 1mm. A beállításoknál a betűméret 16 pixelre emelése ugyan picit javít az olvashatóságon, de azon levelek ahol a kisbetűs részek 9 pixelre vagy kisebbre vannak méretezve olvashatatlanul kicsik. A nagyobbra méretezés egyik hátránya, hogy amikor a levél képet is tartalmaz, és a blokkokra bontott részekben van benne hirdetés, a nagyobbra állított betűk kilógnak a blokkokból, akkor egymásba lógnak zavarva az olvashatóságot, vagy a képre telepednek rá. (Igaz ez a Firefox beállításokra is, így az alap betűméret növelése helyett a teljes oldal nagyítását szoktam 133%-ra vagy 150%-ra állítani).
creator: extravaganter

content:
Szia!

Ahogy magad is tapasztaltad, a betűméretek állítása nem szerencsés, mert sajnos a legtöbb levélküldő nincs rá felkészülve, hogy nem olyan méretben jelenjen meg a levél, ahogy azt ők gondolták. Személy szerint én azt szoktam csinálni (és neked is ezt javaslom), hogy a nehezebben olvasható levelekbe belenagyítok. Ehhez ugyan nincs külön gomb, de a böngészőben is megszokott Ctrl+görgetés itt is működik, hasonlóan a Ctrl+0-hoz, amely visszaállítja 100%-osra a nagyítást.

Ha meg a monitor mérete okoz gondot, akkor a megoldást az operációs rendszer szintjén kell keresni.

Üdv, Balázs

creator: KuchleiT

content: Those unusual and, to us, unknown, passwords, are created by the email provider and stored there, not to be changed by us. It is a special encoding the email provider does to uniquely identify that PC. My guess, and that's all it is, is that any password errors you receive may be temporary errors on the network, since you otherwise do receive the messages.
creator: davidsk

content:
For your first question, I believe you can copy training.dat from one OS to another.

As for insight, the algorithm hasn't changed much in 15+ years, but not many tools to gain insight. But some references and tools do exist.

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/thunderbird-and-junk-spam-messages is one starting point. And a web search should find one or two standalone tools that can analyze the training.dat file.

https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/addon/junquilla/ is/was a nice tool, which perhaps you could adopt and update to work with a current version of Thunderbird. It offered user display and control to tweak Thunderbird's behavior.

Lastly, https://mzl.la/3HYAWos is a list of bug reports which mention "score" or "junquilla" which should offer some insight. And for broader perspective, https://mzl.la/3I4JmdT is a larger list of spam/junk bug reports.
creator: wsmwk

content: For gmail accounts in TB, gmail automatically copies sent messages to Sent Mail, so 'Place a copy in' in the Copies & Folders section of Account Settings should be unchecked. Sent Mail is the folder that should be subscribed, and Sent can be unsubscribed.

content: First, please post only once. Posting the same topic twice causes confusion and causes those wanting assist to try replying to one request while others may be attempting to assist on the other. On your issue, I encourage you to exit libreoffice prior to sending the spreadsheet. when you receive it back to yourself, I suggest renaming it. That is, my fear is that sending to yourself may cause the libreoffice software to be preventing YOU from editing it as a duplicate, an issue that may not affect your recipient. My concern may be incorrect, but there is the chance that you are doing all of this while keeping the spreadsheet open in libreoffice.

creator: Murtagh.colin

content: The Gmail community managed to get me an answer. They suggested that Thunderbird is not set to leave messages on the server after they are downloaded. Trying that and the emails started flowing again. Apparently Gmail releases the messages in batches of a few hundred at a time, and, after they are downloaded, releases more. Most of the time, Gmail recognizes that the messages have been successfully downloaded, but if there is an error during the connection, the messages are left in the download queue until the client deletes them. If the queue fills up, there is no room for the newer messages.
creator: Murtagh.colin

content: Actually, Thunderbird handles POP and leaves on server if user so specifies. Anyway, I'm glad all is working.
